subject: Sexual Health
title: Endometriosis
description: A fast breakdown of Endometriosis for builders.

hook.text: Tissue similar to the uterine lining grows outside the uterus, causing pain millions endure silently.

buildup.text: This tissue can appear on the ovaries, fallopian tubes, and other pelvic organs where it doesn't belong.

discovery.text: Endometriosis affects about 10% of women of reproductive age and is a leading cause of infertility.

twist.text: Diagnosis often takes 7 to 10 years because symptoms are dismissed as normal period pain.

climax.text: Treatments range from pain management to surgery, but there is currently no known cure.

punchline.text: Millions suffer. Awareness speeds up diagnosis.

quiz.question: How long does endometriosis diagnosis typically take?
